thread.title: Musician Robbin Thompson, Springsteen's former bandmate, dies
thread.title_full: Musician Robbin Thompson, Springsteen's former bandmate, dies

author: Layla A. Jones
title: Musician Robbin Thompson, Springsteen's former bandmate, dies
text:
Entertainment Musician Robbin Thompson, Springsteen's former bandmate, dies Rock and roll singer-songwriter and former Bruce Springsteen bandmate Robbin Thompson died Saturday morning at the age of 66 after battling cancer. Musician Robbin Thompson, Springsteen's former bandmate, dies Singer and songwriter Robbin Thompson died Sunday morning. Travel Deals Layla A. Jones Posted: Sunday, October 11, 2015, 6:14 PM 
Rock and roll singer-songwriter and former Bruce Springsteen bandmate Robbin Thompson died Saturday morning at the age of 66 after battling cancer. 
Thompson sang lead in the Steel Mill Band with Bruce Springsteen in the 1970s and was best known for co-writing the official Virginia state song, “Sweet Virginia Breeze,” with Steve Bassett in 1978. 
With a musical career that spanned over 40 years, Thompson wrote on his personal Facebook page in September that he’d been battling cancer for 15 years. 
“These days, it’s causing a few problems,” he wrote, “but I’m dealing with it and will be back performing soon. Like real soon. …” 
Thompson was born in Boston and lived in Florida until he moved to Virginia to study at Virginia Commonwealth University.
